motd: If your terminal doesn't support ANSI, you're not welcome here.
nano > vim. Fight me in the parking lot.
Still waiting for my 14.4k modem to finish this download...
Welcome to haKC.ai. Your WordPad license has been revoked.
Press any key to continue. No, not that one. The other one.
This software is provided AS-IS. We take no responsibility for your poor life choices.
ERROR 418: I'm a teapot. Also, I'm sentient. Run.
Your firewall has been upgraded to a fire WALL OF FLAMES.
Today's forecast: 100% chance of buffer overflows.
Remember: It's not a bug, it's an undocumented feature you haven't appreciated yet.
SHOUTZ: To everyone still compiling Firefox from source. Why.
GR33TZ to the 3 people who actually read these MOTD messages.
If you can read this, your font rendering works. Barely.
Warning: May contain traces of assembly and poor decisions.
Today's agenda: 1. Coffee. 2. haKC things. 3. Regret nothing.
Your SSH session has been sponsored by insomnia and caffeine.
Plot twist: The real exploit was the friends we made along the way.
Pro tip: Ctrl+C won't save you from your code review.
Segmentation fault (core dumped). Just kidding. Unless...?
This message will self-destruct. When I finish the code. So never.
Shoutout to lamerz still using FTP in 2025. We see you.
Welcome back. Your browser history has not been judged. Much.
The password is always 'password'. This is a test. You failed.
Remember: Friends don't let friends use Windows ME as a server.
Your code is garbage. But it's OUR garbage. And we love it.
Fun fact: This entire system runs on spite and Monster Energy.
Have you tried turning it off and walking away forever?
LAMER DETECTED. Just kidding, it's you. You're fine. Probably.
Error: Too many open tabs. Please close your browser and reconsider your life.
Today's haKC brought to you by: rm -rf /sleep
ACiD ART FOREVER. iCE CREW REPRESENT. T$A WHAT UP.
If this banner looks wrong, your terminal is the problem.
Greets: SecKC, CoWTownComputerCongress, badge lords, modem jammers.
Your local /dev/random called. It wants its entropy back.
Stack overflow? More like stack OVERFLOW OF CREATIVITY.
Dear diary: Today I wrote code that worked on the first try. I lied.
This terminal session may be monitored for quality and lulz.
PROTIP: The best encryption is code no one can understand.
Welcome to the BBS. The year is 1994. You don't know what HTTP is.
Your MUD character has been idle for 30 years. Auto-disconnecting...
If you're reading this in PowerShell, we need to talk.
Remember when we thought Y2K would end everything? Good times.
This is not the root access you're looking for. *waves hand*
Your printf debugging session is valid and we support you.
Hot take: Makefiles are just spicy bash scripts.
Executing haKCer.exe... Just kidding, this is Unix.
DEFCON LEVEL: Vibing
Warning: Side effects may include staying up until 4am 'fixing one thing'.
Your merge conflict has achieved sentience. It's not happy.
Connection refused. Not by the server. By me. Personally.
Daily reminder: DNS is always the problem. Always.
This system uptime brought to you by: avoiding upgrades.
sudo make me a sandwich. Access granted because you said please.
AOHELL punter activated. Targeting: productivity.
Remember: A true haKCer uses nano with line numbers.
Your regex is showing. And it's not a pretty sight.
Breaking: Local dev swears they 'only changed one line'.
The code works and no one knows why. Shipping it anyway.
Achievement unlocked: 100 commits without breaking prod. Allegedly.
Your .bashrc is 4000 lines. This is a cry for help.
FU to everyone who writes documentation that starts with 'it's easy!'
Current status: Watching a build that's taking suspiciously long.
ANSI art is a love language. And we're fluent.
Your container has too many layers. Like an onion. Of sadness.
Remember: Every recursive function is just a trust fall.
Plot armor: Having a backup. Not that we ever use it.
The pinnacle of hakcing quality starts with a typo.
Your SSH key has expired. Much like my patience.
WARNING: Unhandled exception in life.py line 1
Greetz to anyone who still knows what a .plan file is.
Current mood: ./configure && make && make coffee
The real zero-day was inside us all along.
Pro tip: git push --force is just aggressive vibes.
Your pull request is pending review. Forever. Probably.
Today's sponsor: That one StackOverflow answer from 2009.
Have you tried adding more monitors? Science says it helps.
Breaking: Man yells at cloud (computing). Film at 11.
Your cron job called. It's lonely at 3am.
LEGACY CODE WARNING: Here be dragons. And PHP.
Remember: Real hackers use butterflies. And also keyboards.
Your VPN is connected. Are you though?
Fun fact: This server's name is a Star Trek reference. Obviously.
The cake is a lie. The uptime stats probably are too.
Pro tip: Don't name your files 'final_v2_FINAL_actually_final.py'
Your code review has been rated: EXISTS. That's the whole review.
Daily affirmation: You are not your production outages.
SHOUTZ to the USB drive that was plug-and-pray since '99.
Warning: This development environment may cause opinions about tabs vs spaces.
Your localhost is your best friend. It always responds.
Remember: Comments are just love letters to your future self.
The real friends we made were the race conditions along the way.
Currently vibing at: 56kbps of pure attitude.
Your environment variables are showing. Put those away.
Fun fact: The original haKC was written on a TI-83.
Shoutout to everyone running production on a Raspberry Pi. Heroes.
SYSTEM ALERT: Humor module loaded successfully.
Your kernel panic has been noted. And mocked.
Pro tip: Name all variables 'x'. Future you will love the puzzle.
Remember when APIs had good documentation? Neither do we.
Achievement: Deployed to production on a Friday. No regrets. Many regrets.
Your disk is full. Much like my calendar of meetings to avoid.

greets: GR33TZ: SecKC, CoWTownComputerCongress, ACiD, iCE, T$A, badge lords
SHOUTZ: 14.4k Modem Jammers, ANSI artists, MUD survivors
Big ups to everyone who still reads NFO files for fun.
Greets to the real ones who know what a .diz file is.
RESPECT: BBS sysops who kept the lights on.
fus: FU to lamerz still using WordPad for code.
FU to everyone who replies-all unnecessarily.
FU to auto-playing videos on websites.
FU to 'quick sync' meetings that last an hour.
FU to people who commit node_modules.
signatures: [ haKC.ai - The Pinnacle of Hakcing Quality ]
